properties.description: A warm, accessible, welcoming space open to everyone. We offer free refreshments, board games, papers and conversation for all ages.
properties.title: Ampthill Community Cafe

properties.address: Ampthill R F C Ltd, Bedford, Bedfordshire MK45 2HX
properties.description: SPACE OPENING ON 28th August 2024** Join us in the Clubhouse every Wednesday 0900-1700 for tea, coffee and snacks. We have a range of games available including dominos and cards whilst having a chat plus a quiet corner to read a book or newspaper.
properties.title: Ampthill Rugby Clubhouse

properties.address: 385A Dunstable Rd, Maidenhall, Luton LU4 8BY, Luton, Bedfordshire LLU4 8BY

properties.title: Beech Hill Methodist Church

properties.address: Astral Park Community Centre, Johnson Drive, Leighton Buzzard, Bedfordshire LU7 4AY
properties.description: A friendly and relaxed community cafe in a peaceful environment. Board games, chat, refreshments, other activities as and when - all free. During term time from 10:00-10:30am we offer Music Movement & Rhyme for 0-4s. During school holiday times we open up the space to children and families for Lego and crafts.
properties.title: CGS - Astral Park Community Centre

properties.description: An inclusive, safe space where all are welcome.
properties.title: Clophill Tea & Chat

properties.address: Flitwick Methodist Church, Bedford, Bedfordshire MK45 1EA
properties.description: A safe, welcoming space open to all
properties.title: Flitwick Tea & Chat

properties.address: St Margarets church, Luton, Bedfordshire Lu3 1HT
properties.description: This is a ladies only space (pre school children can come with mum) Tuesdays and Thursdays provide a place to come along relax or find help along with a cup of tea and a pastry. Drop in at a time that suits you. There are English classes available at certain times for you to begin your learning journey or to grow in confidence.
properties.title: Oasis centre

properties.address: Kents Hill Community Centre, Frithwood Crescent, Kents Hill, Milton Keynes MK7 6HQ
properties.description: Open from Open Now. All are welcome to our well-being space. We don't have specific facilities for children but they are welcome to come along with their grown ups. You may bring a hobby or join in with an activity provided.
properties.title: Renew@KentsHill

properties.address: New Town St, Beds, Beds LU1 3EB
properties.description: Our hall
properties.title: St Pauls Church Luton

properties.description: Open from 13.01.23. A fully accessible space with free food and a warm welcome
properties.title: The Living Room

properties.description: Our Tea and Toast cafe is open and serving free hot refreshments and unlimited toast. Whether you’d like someone to talk to, somewhere warm to be, or somewhere to work, our cafe and team are here to welcome you.
properties.title: The Salvation Army

properties.address: Walnut Tree Pavilion, Walnut Tree, Milton Keynes MK7 7DF
properties.description: Community Hub, open to all
properties.title: Walton Community Council

properties.description: A warm welcome, free teas, coffees, biscuits and a cup of soup. Friendly chats, games plus reading (books available) & quiet area.
properties.title: Word of Faith Centre

properties.description: Luton Libraries are open to the public to join and make use of our building resources. This includes books, PC’s, photocopying and more. We also host regular activities across all our branches for all ages and abilities to join in with. Specific activities taking place in the library, together with any charges as necessary, are listed below. On Mondays from 10:30am to 11:15am a session entitled Mindful Stretch, for which participants are required to pay £3 each session. On Mondays from 4pm to 4:45pm Library Games for children aged 8 years and above. On Tuesdays from 10am to 10:30am Rhyme Time for pre school age children. On Tuesdays from 4:30pm to 5pm Real Play for children aged between 5 and 7 years. On Thursdays from 10am to 10:30am Rhyme Time for pre school age children. On the first Thursday of each month a Reading Group for adults takes place starting at 2pm. On Fridays from 10:30am to 11:15am a session entitled Mindful Yoga, for which participants are required to pay £3 each session. On Fridays from 1pm to 2pm Creative Arts, this is for adults only and participants are required to book in advance. On Saturdays (in term time only) from 11am to 12 noon Code Club for children aged between 8 and 12 years. On Sundays from 11:30am to 12 noon Rhyme Time for pre school age children. Please note that warm drinks/refreshments are not provided by libraries. Members of the public are welcome to bring in their own tea/coffee flasks etc. from elsewhere though. Libraries are open to all during opening hours. Certain activities are age restricted, please speak to a team member for more information. Full details can be found on our website: https://www.lutonlibraries.co.uk/home
properties.title: Luton Central Library

properties.address: Ground Floor, Victoria House, Victoria Street, Luton , LU1 2UA
properties.description: Floating support service which provides housing and benefit advice. The service is tailored to improve people’s opportunity to live successfully in the community. The ethos of the service is to enable, empower and encourage individuals to develop the skills and tools to manage their accommodation, tenancies and health & wellbeing. Warm drinks are available to the public throughout the day. There is no cost to the public for accessing this service.
properties.title: Penrose Synergy

properties.description: We are a Christian faith organisation that also supports the local community where we can. We run a Open Lounge for those in the community to come, have food and build friendships. Our primary focus of our project it is to help combat social isolation. We tend to serve those in central Luton - primarily High Town Cost: Free We offer the following items: Cold meals (e.g. Sandwiches), Hot drinks, Hot meals We have items for these dietary requirements: Gluten free, Vegetarian
properties.title: Hope Church Luton

properties.description: We at Empowering Education offer a weekly food kitchen every Thursday from 5pm until 6.30pm. People wanting to make use of the service should book a meal by messaging on Wednesday before 12 noon on 07555 726984. Other opening times Monday to Friday 9am to 6pm.
properties.title: Empowering Education

properties.address: Corner of Castle &, Hibbert St, LU1 3AL
properties.description: Friendship Friday is on most Fridays 10:30am-1pm. It is open to anyone and you can come for a coffee, chat and lunch is also provided. Friendship Friday is for everyone, but any children who attend must be accompanied and supervised by a parent/carer at all times.
properties.title: Luton Christian Fellowship Church

properties.description: We run coffee mornings on Monday mornings (except Bank Holidays) from 9:30am to 12 noon. We offer free drinks, snacks, biscuits, cakes, fruit etc. for consumption on the premises and an opportunity to chat, play some games and keep warm & dry in bad weather. We operate essentially like a free Café. In addition, we have a small foodbank and a small clothing bank. These are from donations from our members or from the wider church, local supermarket collections and the items available may vary from week to week. There is no charge, it is open to all.
properties.title: High Town Baptist Church

properties.address: Kathleen Connolly House, 102 Hitchin Road, LU2 0ES
properties.description: Luton Irish Forum supports the Irish community in Luton to reach their full potential by providing welfare, social, cultural and volunteering opportunities. Cost: Low-cost, suggested donation of £2 entry to activity. We offer the following items: Hot drinks We have items for these dietary requirements: Gluten free, Vegetarian Internet Cafe, for which there is no charge. Games Club for which there is a suggested donation of £1. We are also a 'Warm Space' from 10am until 12 noon and from 1pm to 2:30pm on a Monday, from 1pm to 3:30pm on a Tuesday, and from 10am until 11:30am on a Thursday.
properties.title: Luton Irish Forum

properties.description:
Welcome Space Warm food and activities. The venue offers a warm welcome and a place to relax and meet others. This service is open to all but it runs in term time only. While there is a charge for some of the Thursday food service provisions listed below, nobody will go home unfed. The food related provision is as follows: 2nd Thursday of the month - Bacon Butty Morning from 10am to 12 noon for which there is a charge of £2.50 per session. 3rd Thursday of the month - Hart Lane Community Lunch, beginning at 12 noon for which there is a charge of £2.50 per session. 4th Thursday of the month - Community Refreshment Stop from 10am to 12 noon and donations are welcomed. Each of these provides opportunities to gather and for friendships to be renewed, made or continued. St Anne's also runs 2 Craft Groups although there is no food at these other than tea and biscuits. They run:
1 - A weekly Craft Group on Tuesdays from 10am - 12 noon in term time only, and 2 - A weekly Scrapbooking and Crafts on Saturdays from 10am until mid afternoon, but please note that this group does not run during the month of August.
properties.title: St Anne's Church

properties.description: Round Green Community Lunch - Warm Food and Conversation. The Community Lunch runs on the first Wednesday of the month during term time in St Christopher's Church Hall, Felix Avenue, LU2 7LE. The Community Lunch invites those attending a warm welcome and a place to relax and meet others. The cost of this service is £2.50 per person. St Christopher's also runs a Craft Group although there is no food at this other than tea, coffee and biscuits. The Craft Group runs on the 4th Saturday of the month from 10am - 12 noon, but it does not run in December or January.
properties.title: St Christopher's Church

properties.description: Every Friday morning from 10:30am to 12:30pm during term time all are welcome to attend the Ramridge Baptist Church Hall, which is located adjacent to the church. We are providing tea, coffee, hot chocolate, cuppa soup, warm pastries, croissants and toast with jam and marmalade, all free of charge. People are free to turn up without needing to book and the service is open to all.
properties.title: Ramridge Baptist Church and Tin Town

properties.description: Luton Libraries are open to the public to join and make use of our building resources. This includes books, PC’s, photocopying and more. We also host regular activities across all our branches for all ages and abilities to join in with. Specific activities taking place in the library, together with any charges as necessary, are listed below. On Tuesdays from 4pm to 4:45pm Library Games for children aged 8 years and above. On Wednesdays from 2pm to 2:30pm Rhyme Time for pre school age children. On the 3rd Wednesday of each month, starting at 2pm, Reading Group for Adults. On Thursdays from 2pm to 2:30pm Rhyme Time for pre school age children. Please note that warm drinks/refreshments are not provided by libraries. Members of the public are welcome to bring in their own tea/coffee flasks etc. from elsewhere though. Libraries are open to all during opening hours. Certain activities are age restricted, please speak to a team member for more information. Full details can be found on our website: https://www.lutonlibraries.co.uk/home
properties.title: Stopsley Library

properties.description: We provide weekly free snacks, soups, rolls and refreshments. Our service is open to everyone and anyone in our local wards which are Wigmore, Stopsley, Vauxhall, Round Green and Crawley. The Community Cafe is a drop in, there is no need to book in advance. We also offer jacket potatoes plus fillings on the first Wednesday of each month, for which we ask for a contribution of £1.
properties.title: Raynham Way Community Centre

properties.description: Luton Libraries are open to the public to join and make use of our building resources. This includes books, PC’s, photocopying and more. We also host regular activities across all our branches for all ages and abilities to join in with. Specific activities taking place in the library, together with any charges as necessary, are listed below. On Mondays from 2pm to 3pm Knit and Natter for adults. On Mondays from 4pm to 5pm Fun Time for Families. On Tuesdays from 10am to 11:30am Happy Babies for children aged between 3 and 12 months. On Tuesdays from 1pm to 2pm Creative Crafts for adults for which participants are required to book. On Wednesdays from 4pm to 4:30pm Real Play for children aged between 5 and 7 years. On Wednesdays, in term time only, are 2 sessions of Rhyme Time for pre school age children. Session 1 is from 9:30am to 10am, and session 2 is from 10:30am to 11am. On Thursdays from 4pm to 4:45pm Library Games for children aged 8 years and above. On the last Thursday of the month, starting at 11am Reading Group for Adults. On Fridays from 10am to 10:30am Story Time for children aged between 2 and 5 years. Please note that warm drinks/refreshments are not provided by libraries. Members of the public are welcome to bring in their own tea/coffee flasks etc. from elsewhere though. Libraries are open to all during opening hours. Certain activities are age restricted, please speak to a team member for more information. Full details can be found on our website: https://www.lutonlibraries.co.uk/home
properties.title: Leagrave Library

properties.description: During the autumn and winter months, on Monday mornings between 9am and 12 noon the venue is a warm space. There is a Coffee Morning at which warm drinks and cakes are available to the public free of charge. We also have a "Community Cupboard" consisting of donated food which is available for distribution or collection free of charge. Please note we cannot guarantee to have everything you require. Other services are being explored as well, watch this space for more news.
properties.title: We are Marsh Farm

properties.description: We are pleased to announce that we reopen on Friday 7 March 2025 and will run weekly on Fridays in term time. Free refreshments, including a hot meal/snack and free craft activities for children; board games are available for self led play. People can turn up without needing to book. Please note the service is open in term time only.
properties.title: Community Cafe - hosted by St Luke's Church, Leagrave

properties.description: During the autumn and winter months, on Thursday mornings between 10am and 12 noon the venue is a warm space. There is a Coffee Morning at which warm drinks and cakes are available to the public free of charge.
properties.title: Marsh Farm Futures
